Really uncomfortable furniture and the bed is as hard as stone. It's wasn't the cleanest either. There was used sponges in the kitchen, and used loofas in the bathroom. The neighborhood is quiet though, but there's a bit of heavy traffic in the mornings. All in all, I got what I paid for.

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This was our very 1st Airbnb experience. We always stay at hotels & resorts but figured since it was one night we could try something new! The host was great. She answered all our questions right away so she definitely gets a 5 star. After we booked she told us more of what to expect being that it was our first time. She said it was a very old home which it is, with airplanes passing nearby (we didn't notice that), with a drummer who is the adjacent neighbor & he does indeed drum at night but it is not cumbersome. The house was much smaller in person than the pictures seem so a very cozy home. It was as clean as you could get an old home & I am a neat freak. Everything really was spotless except like the books & accessories that were coated with dust but everyone misses that. For the price I would not make it my first choice next time, the fees take it to an overpriced stay & all the surrounding hotels were actually cheaper in the end. Checkin was flexible & smooth. Museum nearby

review_text:
Stay was wonderful and the place was very well appointed. Layout and furnishings were thoughtful and the bed very comfortable. Erica was an excellent host, and I really enjoyed the Cooper-Young area of Memphisâ€¦ hip, artsy, and not touristy. Ended up spending a lot of time walking to nearby places and not needing to go down to Beale street or anything to have a good time.
Only very minor retractionsâ€¦ seemed like a prior tenant was a shedder (hair, not cross but present), the bathroom hooks were a little hard to use, and the desk chair could have been a little more comfortable (I work remote and was working full hours though). Completely out of hosts control was that the outdoor cat presence in the â€˜hood left some notable cat smell nearby. And there is a dog daycare type place that had a lot of barking, but only during day. All minor compared to the overall great place and host.

Â·

review_text: My husband & I had such a lovely time staying at Ericaâ€™s property for the weekend. I will say that this is one of the louder Airbnbâ€™s that I have stayed in around the Midtown area to no fault of the host. Duplexes are a hit or miss when it comes to noise, but Ericaâ€™s really makes up for it with its charm. The entire place was spotless, linens were in endless supply, the decor effortlessly cool, and all additional amenities incredibly easy to access and use. Though you can only park on one side of the street (if needed there is an additional space provided in the back), parking was a breeze even when coming in late at night. The best part about our stay was the neighborhood - everything you can imagine needing or wanting is within a 15-20 minute walking distance or 5-10 minute car ride! Erica provided us with all the details we needed before our arrival and even gave us recommendations for places to dine/things to do in the area. 10/10 would stay again!

On our tour in the south of the United States, we did two days in Memphis Station in Erica's duplex.
We particularly appreciated:
â€¢ The central location in a quiet and safe side street in a pleasant living environment, the aircraft noise only perceptible during the day did not bother us
â€¢ We were able to park the car safely right on the street in front of the house
â€¢ For exploring downtown we were able to use the nearby Park and Ride parking lot in Madison Ave and easily reach all the sights for little money by trolley
â€¢ Authentic house with very tasteful furnishings
â€¢ Exemplary amenities with all needful things
â€¢ Spacious kitchen, ideal for us as self-catering
â€¢ Comfortable air conditioning

review_text: Nice cozy place to stay in the Midtown, Cooper/Young area. Local and convenient to lots of good restaurants and downtown Memphis. We visited/ate at places from Collierville to Germantown to Downtown Memphis. Overton park is close and we walked there almost every day. The house is nicely apportioned. A comfortable place to stay for a single or couple. Erica was very responsive to any communication and has easy house rules. Overall, an excellent stay and one that we would be happy to repeat.

The apartment itself was charming, and the bed and linens were super soft and comfortable. The neighborhood is really cute, and the host's recommendations for restaurants and cafes were really helpful. All in all, this was a wonderful experience. Thanks for hosting us!

review_text:
We had a great experience staying at Maggie's place! She and Erica were kind enough to let us book last-minute and were very responsive through the process. We were able to park in the backyard carport, which gave an extra feeling of safety.
The space itself has a lot of old bungalow charm with high ceilings and crown molding; the interior furnishings and finishes were really well-chosen. We walked to a cute nearby restaurant and had a relaxing and romantic evening. The bed was comfortable and the Keurig coffee maker meant we could sleep in without having to find a coffee shop! Overall, I would say this is one of the best (if not THE best) airbnbs I've ever experienced!

review_text:
Lovely 4 day stay here.
We immediately felt welcome with the TV playing music and crickets playing on white noise machine in the bedroom. It also smelt nice.
We have been doing road trip and this was a lovely base to relax and of course visit Graceland. It was tasteful decorated - shabby chic as my husband described. Comfortable furniture and great facilities. We cooked every night in the well equipped kitchen. Minor gripe there was no kettle - we British like our cup of tea! We enjoyed relaxing in the lounge in the evening with Netflix on the TV. Everything was as described. I noted in previous reviews complaints re noise from planes and neighbours playing the drums. The neighbours were quiet and I did not hear planes at night so had a good nights sleep on the fab bed. In fact it was a quiet nice neighbourhood. I would highly recommend staying here.

review_text:
Super cute older neighborhood that has been substantially gentrified since I grew up in Memphis 50 years ago. This back house is quiet and fun. Itâ€™s an older structure with some odd steps here and there so be advised to watch out in the night.
Very clean place. Excellent communication from the host. They have made the best of their structure. But there is no central unit and reaching at one of the window units required standing on a chair. Others have noted the bathroom is small. They are right. It was perfectly serviceable for us but to be honest if you are over six feet tall it will be a struggle.
I try to be honest about issues. But donâ€™t let this seem a negative review. Itâ€™s so close to Cooper Young with its restaurants and bars. The hostâ€™s communication is immaculate. I would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
Our 5 night stay at the Cadillac Cottage in Memphis, TN was one of the best Airbnb experiences we've ever had. The cottage was thoughtfully designed, whimsically decorated, and looked exactly like the listing photos. The location, in the Cooper-Young neighborhood of Memphis, is very safe and central to many unique shops, fantastic restaurants, and local sites. The kitchen was equipped with everything we needed to prepare meals, the bed & bath linens were of nice quality, and the living room sofa & recliner were comfy - like being at home.
Our host, Chris, was immediately responsive to all of our questions and he clearly communicated everything we needed to know before our arrival and made it super easy to check in - especially when our flight was delayed and we arrived after midnight. The Guidebook that Chris provides goes above & beyond. We highly recommend staying here!! Don't think twice - book it now!

name: Peter

Rating, 4 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cadillac Cottage is a nice, private oasis located in the heart of Memphis with convenient ample parking. Go down the driveway between 1869 and 1873 Oliver Ave to get there. Nice decor and kitchen and comfortable furniture including the bed (be aware there is a step down into the BR). TV works great.
Place smelled stale when we arrived, and the toilet was clogged, which made me wonder how well it had been cleaned. I got the toilet unclogged with the plunger. The issue with the smallness of the bathroom is lack of leg room when you sit on the toilet, but I'm a 6'1" 60-year old man and managed just fine. The instructional video for starting the gas heater was for another model, but the new heater was pretty self-explanatory. Video also mentioned an electric heater in the BR closet, which I couldn't find.
Chris was very attentive to all our concerns and brought us an electric heater as well as a nice air purifier.
All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again!

review_text: First, Chris and Debbie are excellent hosts; thank you both so much for being so gracious and accommodating. The space is modest yet was perfect for my solo (and extended) stay in Memphis; it is most ideal for 1 person or a couple. The space was very clean and has a charming outdoor porch that is perfect for morning coffee. The kitchen is great. The bathroom is small but was not an issue and the bedroom is nicely sized with a very comfortable bed. The location in the Cooper Young neighborhood was ideal; there are multiple (and excellent) dining options within walking distance of the cottage. Chris and Debbie were very thoughtful and readily available (they live next door) for anything that I may have needed. I'd absolutely consider the Cadillac Cottage (amongst their other Airbnb options nearby) when I return to Memphis. One would be hard pressed to find better hosts or values in this neighborhood. Thank you again.

The cottage was clean and had everything I needed for my three-week stay. All linens were excellent, the bed comfortable, and the kitchen easy to use, with everything I needed for preparing meals. The cottage is in an extremely convenient part of Memphis; the neighborhood was very quiet during my stay, though one can hear air traffic and train traffic a few times each day. I actually enjoy hearing trains in the distance! Not at all disruptive. I appreciated everything the hosts did to make my stay comfortable, safe, and trouble-free. I particularly appreciated an umbrella left for my use and the motion-sensitive light on the parking side of the cottage--made coming and going after dark a breeze.

Pros: The cottage is in an excellent location for a short stay in Memphis. A quick drive from the city, where everything is easy to get to. It is also in a comfortable neighborhood with a couple of the "go to" Memphis restaurants immediately nearby. Chris is very responsive which was nice.
Possible Improvements: Water never really warmed up for showers. We let Chris know after the 1st day, and he immediately came out and checked it. The next time we used the shower we were on the way out, and we did not notice a difference. Also, the bathroom is a tight squeeze. If you are in the "big and tall" category, it would be challenging for you use the restroom.
Compared to other listings we looked at in similar price ranges, you get a lot out of the cottage. Location, privacy, and responsive host. We enjoyed our time.

We arrived later in the evening and as we approached the area, some of the houses were not well kept (closer to the main street). We did start to hyperventilate a little, UNTIL we got closer to where the property is located. The street is wonderful and as we explored we found that we were in the right place for what we wanted to do.
It was warm and humid (Oct!), but the coolers installed, kept us nice and cool. There was coffee available for our use - Yay!!
The place is super clean, soap, shampoo, wifi, tv and nice furniture. There are even some unique items in the place, charming.
The driveway to the parking is narrow, so just follow the instructions and you will find that parking space in the back. We had the best banana pudding and pulled pork nachos at Central Barbecue, long lines, but the food comes out really fast. We visited the hotel where Martin Luther King Jr. was shot - that is a must - Civil Rights Museum!!
Thank you Chris,
Julie

review_text: The BoHo Condo was a very comfortable, relaxing stay. Tons of natural light in the morning and a beautiful flow throughout the unit. The linens and kitchen was very well stocked with everything you need to cook and the bed was extremely comfortable. Mallory & Tripp have taken great care in furnishing this unit and making it feel like home. Beale Street, Civil Rights Museum are right around the corner, but it is a desolate area at night which can be a little uneasy. The unit itself was initially hard to find as there are many buildings for one address and one main gate entry. It was impossible coordinating an uber drop off/pick up (*use building 85â€¦as your address). Aside from the confusing address, this was an amazing stay and I will certainly book again later this year!

review_text: Place was gorgeous and exactly as pictured. Great location very close to Beale Street and the trolleys and right on Main St. With lots of shops and places to eat nearby or just a short trolley ride. We did have a random fire alarm go off one morning that turned out to be for no reason which was obviously no fault of the hosts, just work being done on the building and Netflix stopped working halfway through our trip (password sharing) so that was a bummer but to be fair we did not message the hosts for a temporary passcode because we did not plan to be up much later that evening and didn't expect an immediate response so we just found something else. Overall it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I really appreciated the accurate descriptions and instructions - all went well - without any issues. The kitchen was well equipped and we made a few of our meals (quality cookware and sharp knives are important but often overlooked in vacation rentals). I appreciated the willingness of the host to help us navigate safely through Memphis. We wanted to explore different neighbourhoods and we did so successfully based on the hostsâ€™ guidance. The proximity of the Metcalfe location to Madison Avenue, Cooper Street and Overton Park creates many diverse experiences, whether you are seeking live music, food, shopping, art or a visit to the Zoo, as well as walking past historic homes. We also stayed in one of the hosts downtown rentals and again the instructions were accurate, the accommodation was as described and well equipped. For the most part it felt safe to be downtown and it was wonderful to compare and contrast the neighbourhoods. We would recommend others stay in either location.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Wonderful stay at Mallory and Tripâ€™s condo. Itâ€™s very clean, beautifully decorated and had everything we needed. The coffee supply was especially nice. But the real star is the location. It was perfect. A short walk to the Civil Rights Museum (a must see), bars, restaurants and downtown. We always felt very safe. If you want to pick up groceries, go to the South Point Grocery, a few blocks away. It has everything you need from beer and wine to produce, cheese, meats and specialty items. Go to SOB for dinner. Itâ€™s great. Pick up a Blueberry Lemon Scone and coffee at Hustle and Dough. Have pizza at Little Italy. It was sublime. Stop for a craft beer at Wise Acre. Go to Sun Studios and then to Graceland, so youâ€™ll know a little history. See the March of the Ducks at the Peabody. Walk across the Harahan Bridge to Arkansas. Have real Memphis BBQ at Charlie Vergos.. So many great things to do at your doorstep. We highly recommend this place.

On a positive note, you are close to Beale street, the civil rights museum, the river front and multiple restaurants. All within walking distance.
So if the nighttime interruptions do not bother you, then this beautiful space is highly recommended.

review_text: Mallory &Trippâ€™s Boho apartment was just as described in the listing! The loft was very chic and stylishly appointed. The location cannot be beat, just a half block off of Main Street, about 2 blocks from an adorable river walk along the Mississippi and only about a 6 minute walk to Beale street. There were several wonderful places to eat very close by (We loved the Slider Inn, Gusâ€™s Chicken and Cupcake Cutie), a full service movie theater within walking distance and a couple cute boutique type shops. The living room couch was comfy, the bathroom was very modern and the bedroom was spacious. The bed linens were very luxurious, the bed was comfortable, and there was lots of closet space. The room can be a bit bright at night (street lights) and in the morning so if you are light sensitive bring a sleep mask. The kitchen was fine for light cooking, we made breakfast every day, but cooking is not what you are in Memphis for anyways! Communication was excellent before and during our stay. We love this apartment and Memphis and hope to come back to both again!

Our hosts, Pixie, Richard and their two charming canine companions (Baxter and his young ward, Bailey), provided us with everything we could have needed. Big screen TV (check!), Microwave and Fridge (Check!), Snacks (Check!), Beautiful, art museum-worthy original oil paintings (Check!), Beautiful flowers and plants (Check!) Reading material, (Check!). The linnens were crisp and the towels were plush. It was a beautiful space. I could go on and on. However, brevity dictates I conclude with... Our hosts went above and beyond. WE WILL BE BACK

Was a perfect touch after driving all day. I thought I would go out and explore a little bit but it was so comfortable. I ended up just staying in and watching Netflix in bed. I felt at home! I loved that they left snacks and drinks in the mini fridge as well as a fully stocked coffee bar. You can tell how much they love to be hosts, and these are the exact people that I love to stay with.â¤ï¸ thank you Pixie and Richard !

name: Leslie

November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Queen's Gambit is very conveniently located within walking distance to museums, Beale Street and restaurants. We never moved our car once it was parked. The neighborhood "looks" a little sketchy, but it's not with some really nice restaurants and bars just a block or two away. We highly recommend the Rock and Soul museum and you can't come to Memphis and not go to the National Civil Rights museum. Since we were there during the week, there wasn't as much music going on, but we had a very enjoyable time at BB King's with good food and live music.
The apartment is on the second floor, so there are stairs involved. I would only caution anyone over 6 ft tall and is a back sleeper that the bed, though really comfortable is a California king on a regular king bed frame...so the end of the bed is sitting on top of the end of the frame and is raised so your feet are up higher. For everyone else, it will be great.
Hosts were really responsive when we had questions...highly recommend!

If you don't know if you should stay here... DO IT! My wife and I stayed here for a few days and it was fabulous. From the initial request to stay till we left. Jon was very direct and on time with any check-in details. They provide any cleaning material needed. There are two smart tvs connected to the wifi. Plenty of space to LIVE for a few days. We had enough room to fully unpack and actually enjoy the time without fighting over space. The fact that it is in a gated community with off street parking while only being a few blocks from downtown (Beale) is tremendous. Jon is quick to reply if we had a concern and helped us to feel appreciated and welcome. We were so happy with our stay we actually went a couple steps above and beyond the checkout list, which is literally only a couple things to do anyway!
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will absolutely be shooting for this place if we are ever in town again.

I had the pleasure of staying at Lauren's house recently and it truly exceeded all my expectations. This is hands down one of the best experiences I've had with Airbnb. One of the standout features is the high level of privacy - you don't have to share the space with the owners, making for a very comfortable and relaxing stay.
Thoughtful touches didn't go unnoticed either - there was plenty of water, soda and coffee, which added a homey and functional feel to our stay. The location couldn't be better. It's perfect for exploring downtown Memphis and the nearby museums and restaurants.
Without a doubt, my wife and I are already planning our return trip. Thank you host for such a great experience. We can't wait to come back!
